metadata.feature_description: Shows template status indicators like Hidden, Disabled, or Published

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Feature Accessibility - Page Templates Panel Loads

steps.action: Navigate to Manage > Templates in PersonaBar
steps.actual: Page Templates panel opened successfully with heading, search box, and Add Template button

steps.action: Verify Page Templates UI elements are accessible
steps.expected: Should display template list or empty state message
steps.actual: Panel displayed with message 'You must save an existing page as a template prior to create a new template' indicating no templates exist

steps.action: View template list to verify status indicators (Hidden, Disabled, Published)
steps.expected: Templates should display with status indicators where applicable
steps.actual: No templates exist in the system. Template list is empty. Status indicators cannot be verified without templates.

steps.action: Attempted to create a template from existing page via Pages > Save Page Template > Evoq Page Template
steps.expected: Template should be created successfully to test status display
steps.actual: Template creation failed with HTTP 500 Internal Server Error. Error message: 'There was an error retrieving your content.'

issues: No templates exist in the system to test status display feature
Template creation via 'Save Page Template' fails with server error (HTTP 500)

observations: Code review shows status is determined by GetTabStatus() method in PageManagementController.cs which returns: 'Disabled' (when tab.DisableLink is true), 'Hidden' (when tab.IsVisible is false), or 'Visible' (when tab.IsVisible is true)
HTML template (Templates.html line 82) shows status indicator span only becomes visible when status is 'Hidden' or 'Disabled', not for 'Visible' (Published) status
The Page Templates feature loads and is accessible through Manage > Templates menu
Templates must be created from existing pages using 'Save Page Template' functionality - no templates currently exist in the test environment
Attempting to create a template resulted in a server error (HTTP 500), preventing full testing of the status display feature
